segments.text: I observe the woman at the sink, her hands busy with the dish towel.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window illuminates her serene face.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden looks so inviting and well-kept.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Inside, though, water is spilling over the sink's edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's sad she hasn't noticed; it could ruin the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the puddle, and she just keeps drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are trying to get cookies without her knowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool looks so precarious, one hand in the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl reaches up, hopeful for her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's heartbreaking thinking about a possible accident here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All this mischief in such a normal setting feels off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she would turn around and see what's going on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The innocence of the children mixed with danger is just too much.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene tugs at my heartstrings in a melancholic way.
segments.speaker: PAR
